kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
I can think of 2 options
1. Store comments as a custom [object type](https://docs.kentico.com/x/AKDWCQ), give them a reference to the article (like `CommentArticleID`) and then create a custom ASP.NET Core API endpoint that returns all comments for a given article. Marketers can manage the comments [in a custom application](https://docs.kentico.com/x/GwKQC). The Kentico Community Portal stores Q\&A discussion answers as [a custom object type](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.2.2.1/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Core/Modules/QAndAAnswerData/QAndAAnswerDataInfo.generated.cs). 2. Store comments as content items linked through a field on the article content item. This would [expose them through the headless channel](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/development/content-retrieval/retrieve-headless-content#prepare-graphql-queries) (GraphQL API). Marketers can manage them as normal content items linked to the articles.
Either way you will need a custom API endpoint to handle requests from your external application when users submit comments - it's up to you how you want to store them.
I **do not** recommend using the Form Builder and form submissions - that's not what this feature is designed for.
